title: A Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte
output:
Important things to remember:
 - Uses pointillism, one of the first historically significant works using it.
- A very large painting (7 feet in height; 10 feet in width)
 - Depicts people from various walks of life in Paris
 - the sun shines on the working class, but the middle class is shrouded in shadows, perhaps conveying the slow decline of the middle class and the rise of the working class

title: Still Life with Apples
output:
Important things to remember:
 - The painting is a still life, but Cezanne has used various angles and perspectives to give the painting a sense of movement.
 - The painting is an early example of Cezanne's "cubism", which would later be developed by Pablo Picasso and Georges Braque.

title: A Philosopher Lecturing on the Orrery
output:
Important things to remember:
 - The painting conveys the Enlightenment ideal of using reason and science to understand the world.
 - The orrery is a mechanical model of the solar system, which was a popular scientific curiosity in the 18th century.
 - The philosopher in the painting is shown lecturing on the orrery, perhaps conveying the idea that understanding the world is within everyone's reach.

title: Las Meninas
output:
Important things to remember:
 - The painting depicts Infanta Margarita Teresa, the daughter of King Philip IV, surrounded by her ladies-in-waiting (meninas).
 - The other occupants of the room are Velazquez himself, who is reflected in a mirror, and a dwarf named Nicolas Pertusato.
 - The position of the occupants in the room and their relationship to each other is a referance to the hierarchy of the Spanish court

title: The Harvesters

Important things to remember:
 - It is one of the first paintings to realistically depict the daily lives of peasants. Prior to this, most paintings depicted religious scenes or events from classical mythology. This painting, however, gives us a glimpse into the real lives of real people.

title: Judith Slaying Holofernes
output:
Important things to remember:
 - One of the most significant aspects of Gentileschi's Judith Slaying Holofernes is the fact that it was created by a woman. At the time it was painted, women were not typically associated with the world of art, so this painting was a groundbreaking achievement. Additionally, the painting is incredibly violent, with Judith beheading Holofernes in a gruesome manner. This was likely a statement by Gentileschi on the plight of women during her time, who were often victims of violence.

title: Church of San Carlo alle Quattro Fontane
output:
Important things to remember:
 - The church's facade is an early example of Baroque architecture, and its oval plan was a new concept for church design.
 - The church is also significant for its use of light and shadow; the sunlight streaming through the windows creates a beautiful play of light and shadow inside the church.

title: David
output:
Important things to remember:
 - One of the most famous sculptures in the world, Michelangelo's David has come to represent the ideal of male beauty, depicting David heroically nude with perfect proportions.
 - It also symbolizes the triumph of the human spirit, as David represents not only an idealized physical form, but also a brave and determined leader.

title: The Entombment of Christ
output:
Important things to remember:

title: Salon de la Princesse
output:
Important things to remember:
 - Boffrand's Salon de la Princesse is considered one of the most significant cultural achievements of the 18th century. It was one of the most lavish and expensive rooms ever created, and its opulent design reflected the growing wealth and power of the French aristocracy. The room was a symbol of the excesses of the aristocracy, and its eventual downfall.

title: Saint Teresa of Avila in ecstasy
output:
Important things to remember:
 - The work is incredibly detailed, with each muscle and tendon of Teresa's body carefully sculpted to convey the movement of her body as she is transported by her vision of the angel.

title: The Last Supper
output:
Important things to remember:
 - the painting is an important early example of the use of perspective in art, and its technical mastery has been admired for centuries
 - The painting was commissioned by Duke Ludovico Sforza for the refectory of his monastery in Milan

title: Foundling Hospital
output:
Important things to remember:
 - It was designed to house abandoned babies, and was one of the first institutions of its kind.
 - The building is noted for its symmetry and for its use of classical proportions.
 - It is an early example of a building designed to be both functional and aesthetically pleasing.

title: Death of Marat
output:
Important things to remember:
 - It depicts the assassination of Jean-Paul Marat, one of the most important leaders of the French Revolution.
 - The work is significant because it shows the brutal reality of the Revolution, and the lengths that people were willing to go to in order to achieve their goals.

title: The Banjo Lesson
output:
Important things to remember:
 - The Banjo Lesson was painted during the Harlem Renaissance, a time when African American culture was flourishing.
 - The painting is a reminder of the important contributions that African Americans have made to American culture.

title: The Raft of the Medusa
output:
Important things to remember:
 - The painting depicts the aftermath of the 1816 shipwreck of the Medusa, in which over 150 people were stranded on a raft for 13 days without food or water. Of the 150 people, only 15 survived.
 - The painting is also significant for its political and social commentary, as it criticizes the French government's handling of the shipwreck and highlights the plight of the working class.

title: Julia Jackson
output:
Important things to remember:
 - Julia Margaret Cameron was one of the first female photographers, and she is considered one of the most significant photographers of the 19th century.
 - Cameron's work helped to popularize photography as an art form, and her experimentation with techniques like soft focus and close-up compositions influenced many subsequent photographers.

title: Third of May, 1808

Important things to remember:

 - The painting also highlights the heroism of the Spanish people in the face of oppression.
